meanings.definition: The state of being illiquid; lack of liquidity.
meanings.sent1: The illiquidity of the investment made it difficult to access funds quickly.
meanings.sent2: Illiquidity in the market can lead to delays in transactions.
meanings.sent3: The illiquidity of the situation made everyone scramble for solutions.
meanings.sent4: Her illiquidity in decision-making left her stuck in a loop of uncertainty.
meanings.sent5: The illiquidity of the river made it impossible for boats to navigate smoothly.

meanings.definition: The quality of an asset that cannot be easily converted into cash without a significant loss in value.
meanings.sent1: The illiquidity of the antique collection made it hard to sell quickly.
meanings.sent2: Investors should be cautious of illiquidity when choosing assets.
meanings.sent3: The illiquidity of the painting added a layer of complexity to its value.
meanings.sent4: His illiquidity in assets tied up his wealth in non-liquid forms.
meanings.sent5: The illiquidity of the diamond made it a challenging asset to trade.
